title: Bound Print, "Design for an Orangerie", 1808
medium: Aquatint, brush and watercolor on cream wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, under orangerie: Design for an Orangerie / the frame of glass removed in summer, it forms a Chiosk; above floor plan: The Corridor; below floor plan: London: Pub. May 1, 1808 by J. C. Stadler, 15 Villiers Street, Strand
dimensions:
H x W (Exterior): 15 x 22 cm (5 7/8 x 8 11/16 in.)
H x W (Interior: floor plan): 12.5 x 19.5 cm (4 15/16 x 7 11/16 in.)
Platemark: 42 x 29 cm (16 9/16 x 11 7/16 in.)
description:
Exterior: Façade of orangerie, pots of greenery seen through tilted paned windows. Shown in a winter setting with snow on the ground and bare snow-covered trees behind the structure
Interior: Floor plan of the corridor of the orangerie

tombstone.epitaph: Bound Print, "Design for an Orangerie", 1808. Aquatint, brush and watercolor on cream wove paper. 1956-156-1-i.
